snippet: In a meeting with military commanders from 21 nations, the president pointed to the coalition’s success against the Islamic State, but cautioned that progress would take time.
abstract: Pres Obama predicts periods of progress and setbacks in war against Islamic State militants, praising initial success of effort but warning headway will take time; remarks come amid unusual address before senior military chiefs from 21 nations, at which Obama seeks to demonstrate a unity of purpose in the coalition's offensive.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: In a meeting with military commanders from 21 nations, the president pointed to the coalition’s success against the Islamic State, but cautioned that progress would take time.

headline.main: Obama Says Coalition Is in Long-Term Fight Against Militants
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Coalition Is in Long-Term Fight Against Militants

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
